      • isAttributeTarget

        public static final boolean isAttributeTarget(java.lang.String name)
        Checks if the specified name identifies an attribute target within a template ("$.").
        Parameters:
        name - the name to check
        Returns:
        true if check succeeds, false otherwise

      • isAttributeVariable

        public static final boolean isAttributeVariable(java.lang.String name)
        Checks if the valid name of an attribute variable. This is the case if it starts with "$$" but is not the default variable.
        Parameters:
        name - the name to check
        Returns:
        true if check succeeds, false otherwise

      • isDefault

        public static boolean isDefault(java.lang.String name)
        Checks if the specified name is the name of the default variable ("$$").
        Parameters:
        name - the name to check
        Returns:
        true if check succeeds, false otherwise

      • isRuleVariable

        public static final boolean isRuleVariable(java.lang.String name)
        Checks if the specified name is a valid name of a rule variable. This is the case if it starts with "$$".
        Parameters:
        name - the name to check
        Returns:
        true if check succeeds, false otherwise

      • isTemplateFileName

        public static final boolean isTemplateFileName(java.lang.String name)
        Checks if the specified name is the file name of a template file. This is the case if it ends with "_TEMPLATE.xml".
        Parameters:
        name - the name to check
        Returns:
        true if check succeeds, false otherwise

      • isVariable

        public static final boolean isVariable(java.lang.String name)
        Checks if the specified name is the name of any variable. This is the case if it starts with $.
        Parameters:
        name - the name to check
        Returns:
        true if check succeeds, false otherwise

      • normalizeTemplateOrVarName

        public static final java.lang.String normalizeTemplateOrVarName(java.lang.String name)
        Returns the specified name without any leading or trailing "$".
        Parameters:
        name - the name
        Returns:
        the normalized name without leading/trailing $
